analyzed: khyab par byed pa ni lus kyi tshigs thams cad la gnas shing gzugs kyi phung po mngon par skyed pa'i las can no //

translated: They should be known as the nature of the five great elements such as earth, the five Tathagatas, the five colors, and the five pristine awarenesses that perform the functions of pacifying and so forth.

analyzed: de'i rjes su nyi ma dang rdo rje'i steng du aa: tsheg drag can dmar po bsams te /
translated: After that, one imagines an A with a visarga, red, on top of the sun and vajra.

original: de'i rjes la padma dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du thig le dang bcas pa dbyangs yig dang po dkar po la bltas te /
analyzed: de'i rjes la padma dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du thig le dang bcas pa dbyangs yig dang po dkar po la bltas te /
translated: After that, one sees the first vowel, white, together with a drop on top of a lotus and moon disk.

original: de dag thams cad yongs su gyur pa las snga ma bzhin du lha'i gzugs yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ba'i snang ba thob pa la sogs pa'i rim pas bdag byin gyis rlob pa'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad yongs su gyur pa las snga ma bzhin du lha'i gzugs yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ba'i snang ba thob pa la sogs pa'i rim pas bdag byin gyis rlob pa'o //
translated: All of that is totally transformed, and by the process of attaining the appearance called ‚Äúthe complete form of the deity,‚Äù one should consecrate oneself.

original: gal te yang sa bon dang mtshan ma yongs su gyur pa las byung ba'i rnam pa yin yang /
analyzed: gal te yang sa bon dang mtshan ma yongs su gyur pa las byung ba'i rnam pa yin yang /
translated: Even though the aspect arises from the transformation of the seed and the sign,

original: 'on kyang sgyu ma la sogs pa'i dpe rnams kyis nye bar brgyan pas na bskyed pa'i rim pa las @37b khyad par du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang sgyu ma la sogs pa'i dpe rnams kyis nye bar brgyan pas na bskyed pa'i rim pa las @37b khyad par du gyur pa'o //
translated: it is superior to the stage of creation because it is adorned with the examples of illusion, etc.

original: gang gi phyir bskyed pa'i rim pa las sgyu ma nyid du mthong ba med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bskyed pa'i rim pa las sgyu ma nyid du mthong ba med do //
translated: For, in the stage of creation, one does not see the illusory nature of things,

original: lha'i nga rgyal kho na der bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha'i nga rgyal kho na der bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one is to accomplish only the divine pride.

original: lha'i nga rgyal dang sgyu ma lta bur mthong ba dag ni phan tshun 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: lha'i nga rgyal dang sgyu ma lta bur mthong ba dag ni phan tshun 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Divine pride and the perception of things as illusions are mutually exclusive.

original: de bas na lha'i rnal 'byor rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de bas na lha'i rnal 'byor rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Therefore, there are two kinds of divine yoga:

original: rtog pa dang yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa dang yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: conceptual and complete.

original: de la rtog pa'i rnal 'byor ni zla ba dang rdo rje la sogs pa yongs su gyur pa las skyes pa /
analyzed: de la rtog pa'i rnal 'byor ni zla ba dang rdo rje la sogs pa yongs su gyur pa las skyes pa /
translated: The yoga of conceptualization is the creation of the deity from the transformation of the moon and vajra and so on.üîΩ

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i spyod yul sngags kyi sku'o //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i spyod yul sngags kyi sku'o //
translated: The yoga of imagination is the mantra body, the object of the yoga of the creation stage, which arises from the transformation of the moon, vajra, etc.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor ni myur ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rdzogs pa'am /
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor ni myur ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rdzogs pa'am /
translated: The yoga of perfection is the gnosis body generated by the stage of attaining the light, etc.

original: snang ba thob pa la sogs pa'i rim pa las bskyed pa'i ye shes kyi sku yin pas khyad par yod pa kho na'o zhes bdag la byin gyis rlob pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba thob pa la sogs pa'i rim pa las bskyed pa'i ye shes kyi sku yin pas khyad par yod pa kho na'o zhes bdag la byin gyis rlob pa'o //
translated: Thus, there is a difference, and so the consecration of oneself is taught.

original: da ni sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin yang rnam par dag par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: da ni sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin yang rnam par dag par bya ba yin te /
translated: Now, the illusion-like meditative concentration is also to be purified,

original: rtog pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is associated with imagination.

original: de'i phyir don dam pa'i bden pa'i ngo bo nyid mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pas de bzhin nyid kyis sbyang bar bya ba'i phyir mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam pa'i bden pa'i ngo bo nyid mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pas de bzhin nyid kyis sbyang bar bya ba'i phyir mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa bstan par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the stage of manifest enlightenment, which is the essence of ultimate reality, is taught in order to purify suchness by means of the stage of manifest enlightenment.

original: de la yang rnam pa gnyis yin te /
analyzed: de la yang rnam pa gnyis yin te /
translated: This has two parts:

original: phyag rgya dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi bye brag gis so //
analyzed: phyag rgya dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi bye brag gis so //
translated: the stages of the seal and the stages of meditative stabilization.

original: phyag rgya'i rim pa la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: phyag rgya'i rim pa la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The stages of the seal have two parts:

original: phyi'i mngon par byang chub pa dang / nang gi mngon par byang chub pa'o //
analyzed: phyi'i mngon par byang chub pa dang / nang gi mngon par byang chub pa'o //
translated: outer manifest enlightenment and inner manifest enlightenment.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi mngon par byang chub pa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi mngon par byang chub pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The stages of meditative stabilization have two parts:

original: ril po 'dzin pa dang / rjes su gzhig pa'o //
analyzed: ril po 'dzin pa dang / rjes su gzhig pa'o //
translated: grasping the whole and subsequent destruction.

original: de la phyag rgya'i rim pa bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de la phyag rgya'i rim pa bstan par bya ste /
translated: Now, the stages of the seal will be explained.

original: dang po re zhig sgrub pa pos slob dpon dang gsang ba'i dbang thob pas shes rab kyi dbang bskur ba thob par bya ba'i phyir phyi dang nang dang gsang ba'i mchod pa rnams kyis rdo rje slob dpon mchod par bya ste /
analyzed: dang po re zhig sgrub pa pos slob dpon dang gsang ba'i dbang thob pas shes rab kyi dbang bskur ba thob par bya ba'i phyir phyi dang nang dang gsang ba'i mchod pa rnams kyis rdo rje slob dpon mchod par bya ste /
translated: First, the practitioner who has obtained the master and secret initiations should worship the vajra master with outer, inner, and secret offerings in order to obtain the wisdom initiation.

original: de la phyi'i mchod pa ni mchod pa rnam pa lnga'o //üîΩnang gi mchod pa ni go ku da ha na /
analyzed: de la phyi'i mchod pa ni mchod pa rnam pa lnga'o // nang gi mchod pa ni go ku da ha na /
translated: Therein, the outer worship is the five offerings.

original: ma ra bi sha mu zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ma ra bi sha mu zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The inner worship is the characteristics of go, ku, da, ha, and na.

original: gsang ba'i mchod pa ni lo bcu gnyis pa gzugs bzang brgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: gsang ba'i mchod pa ni lo bcu gnyis pa gzugs bzang brgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
translated: The secret offering is a girl of the warrior caste, who is twelve years old, beautiful, adorned with all ornaments,

original: dri dang me tog gis nye bar mdzes pa'i lus can rdol ba'i rigs kyi bu mo dam tshig dang sdom pa la gnas pa /
analyzed: dri dang me tog gis nye bar mdzes pa'i lus can rdol ba'i rigs kyi bu mo dam tshig dang sdom pa la gnas pa /
translated: her body beautified with perfume and flowers, who is a daughter of a good family, who abides in the vows and pledges,

original: thos pa dang bsam pa dang sgom pa'i rim gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor ma rdo rje slob dpon la dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: thos pa dang bsam pa dang sgom pa'i rim gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor ma rdo rje slob dpon la dbul bar bya'o //
translated: and who is endowed with the perfection of wisdom through the stages of hearing, reflection, and meditation.

original: @38a * // de'i rjes su dkon mchog gsum tshim par bya ba'i phyir tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i nang du yang de mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: @38a * // de'i rjes su dkon mchog gsum tshim par bya ba'i phyir tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i nang du yang de mchod par bya'o //
translated: After that, in order to satisfy the Three Jewels, one should also offer her in the midst of the ga·πáa cakra.

original: de la dang po re zhig nyan thos kyi rigs ma gtogs pa dge slong dang dge tshul dang rdo rje slob dpon dang dge bsnyen rnams spyan drangs te /
analyzed: de la dang po re zhig nyan thos kyi rigs ma gtogs pa dge slong dang dge tshul dang rdo rje slob dpon dang dge bsnyen rnams spyan drangs te /
translated: There, first of all, one should invite the monks, novices, vajra masters, and laypeople, except for those of the ≈õrƒÅvaka caste.

original: de rnams la go rims bzhin du brtul zhugs kyi rgan gzhon gyi rim pas gdan rnams dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams la go rims bzhin du brtul zhugs kyi rgan gzhon gyi rim pas gdan rnams dbul bar bya'o //
translated: To them, one should offer seats in order, according to the order of seniority in spiritual discipline.

original: de la rim pa gcig la dge slong gi tshogs dgod pa dang / gnyis pa la dge tshul gyi tshogs dang / gsum pa la rdo rje slob dpon gyi tshogs dang / dge bsnyen gyi tshogs so //
analyzed: de la rim pa gcig la dge slong gi tshogs dgod pa dang / gnyis pa la dge tshul gyi tshogs dang / gsum pa la rdo rje slob dpon gyi tshogs dang / dge bsnyen gyi tshogs so //
translated: In one of the stages, the assembly of fully ordained monks is placed, in the second, the assembly of novices, in the third, the assembly of vajra masters, and in the fourth, the assembly of male and female lay practitioners.

original: gal te dge slong rnams rdo rje slob dpon du gyur na de rnams kyi mdun du brtul zhugs can dang brtul zhugs can ma yin pa rnams dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te dge slong rnams rdo rje slob dpon du gyur na de rnams kyi mdun du brtul zhugs can dang brtul zhugs can ma yin pa rnams dgod par bya'o //
translated: If the fully ordained monks are the vajra masters, then in front of them the practitioners and non-practitioners should be placed.

original: gal te dge bsnyen rdo rje slob dpon du gyur na /
analyzed: gal te dge bsnyen rdo rje slob dpon du gyur na /
translated: If the male and female lay practitioners are the vajra masters,

original: de'i mdun du dge slong slob ma dang slob ma ma yin pa rnams dgod par bya'o //üîΩrnal 'byor pa'i tshogs rnams ni rab tu byung ba'am /
analyzed: de'i mdun du dge slong slob ma dang slob ma ma yin pa rnams dgod par bya'o // rnal 'byor pa'i tshogs rnams ni rab tu byung ba'am /
translated: then in front of them the fully ordained monks, whether students or not, should be placed.

original: rab tu ma byung ba rnams rnam pa thams cad du gong du dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu ma byung ba rnams rnam pa thams cad du gong du dgod par bya'o //
translated: The assembly of yogis, whether ordained or not, should always be placed above.

original: dge slong ngam dge tshul lam dge bsnyen yin yang rung la /
analyzed: dge slong ngam dge tshul lam dge bsnyen yin yang rung la /
translated: Whether fully ordained monks, novices, or lay practitioners,

original: rnal 'byor pas rtags dang ldan pa yin na tshogs kyi bdag por bya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas rtags dang ldan pa yin na tshogs kyi bdag por bya'o //
translated: if they possess the signs of a yogi, they should be made the master of the assembly.

original: thams cad rim pa bzhin du bzhugs par mthong nas las kyi rdo rje mdun du phyin te phyag 'tshal ba sngon du 'gro bar rgan gzhon gyi rim pas re re la zhabs bsil dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad rim pa bzhin du bzhugs par mthong nas las kyi rdo rje mdun du phyin te phyag 'tshal ba sngon du 'gro bar rgan gzhon gyi rim pas re re la zhabs bsil dbul bar bya'o //
translated: Having seen them all seated in order, the karma vajra should go in front and, having first made prostrations, offer foot washing water to each one in order of seniority.

original: de'i rjes su mchod pa rnam pa lngas mchod de lag pa g-yas pas bdud rtsi lngas bkang ba'i padma'i snod blangs te /
analyzed: de'i rjes su mchod pa rnam pa lngas mchod de lag pa g-yas pas bdud rtsi lngas bkang ba'i padma'i snod blangs te /
translated: After that, having made offerings with the five offerings, one should take up with the right hand the lotus vessel filled with the five nectars,

original: lag pa g-yon pa'i srin lag dang mthe bong gis de rnams kyi mdun du gru gsum pa chos 'byung ba'i phyag rgya bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: lag pa g-yon pa'i srin lag dang mthe bong gis de rnams kyi mdun du gru gsum pa chos 'byung ba'i phyag rgya bri bar bya'o //
translated: and with the ring finger and thumb of the left hand draw the triangle mudra of the source of phenomena in front of them.

original: de'i nang du thig le zlum po bris te /
analyzed: de'i nang du thig le zlum po bris te /
translated: In the middle of that, one should draw a circle bindu.

original: de'i yang nang du dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo dag blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i yang nang du dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo dag blta bar bya'o //
translated: In the middle of that, one should visualize the ma·πá·∏çala wheels.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po la sogs pa'i thugs kar sems dpa' gnyis po snod dang bcud kyi ngo bo nyid ma lus par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po la sogs pa'i thugs kar sems dpa' gnyis po snod dang bcud kyi ngo bo nyid ma lus par blta bar bya'o //
translated: In the heart of the principal ma·πá·∏çala and so on, one should visualize the two sattvas, the essence of the vessel and the essence of the contents.

original: de'i shar gyi zur gyi steng du bdud rtsi lngas gang ba'i snod dang / thabs dang shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid hri h'um dag gis byin gyis brlabs pa myos byed dang sbyar ba'i chang gis bkang ba'i snod gnyis ni dbus kyi snod kyi logs gnyis su gzhag par byas la /
analyzed: de'i shar gyi zur gyi steng du bdud rtsi lngas gang ba'i snod dang / thabs dang shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid hri h'um dag gis byin gyis brlabs pa myos byed dang sbyar ba'i chang gis bkang ba'i snod gnyis ni dbus kyi snod kyi logs gnyis su gzhag par byas la /
translated: On the eastern side of the upper part of that, one should place two vessels filled with the five elixirs and with liquor mixed with intoxicants, consecrated with the essences of method and wisdom, HRIH and HUM, respectively, on the two sides of the central vessel.

original: nag po dang dmar po dang @38b dkar po'i ras kyis kha bkab la me tog snyim pas gtor bar byas te /
analyzed: nag po dang dmar po dang @38b dkar po'i ras kyis kha bkab la me tog snyim pas gtor bar byas te /
translated: Covering the mouths of the vessels with black, red, and white cloth, one should scatter flowers with one's cupped hands.

original: thugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i sngags kyis byin gyis brlab bar bya'o //
analyzed: thugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i sngags kyis byin gyis brlab bar bya'o //
translated: One should consecrate them with the mantras of Cittavajra and so forth.

original: de nas phyag byas te dbus kyi snod las thigs pa gsum gsum blangs te /
analyzed: de nas phyag byas te dbus kyi snod las thigs pa gsum gsum blangs te /
translated: Then, having made obeisance, one should take three drops from the central vessel and

original: g-yas g-yon gyi snod dag tu gtor bar bya zhing myos byed kyi snod dam chang gi snod blangs la rnal 'byor pa rnams la las kyi rdo rjes dang po bsnyod par bya'o //
analyzed: g-yas g-yon gyi snod dag tu gtor bar bya zhing myos byed kyi snod dam chang gi snod blangs la rnal 'byor pa rnams la las kyi rdo rjes dang po bsnyod par bya'o //
translated: throw them into the right and left vessels. Taking the vessel of intoxicants or the vessel of liquor, the vajra master should first serve the yogis.

original: de'i rjes su dge slong dang / dge tshul dang dge bsnyen gyi tshogs la'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su dge slong dang / dge tshul dang dge bsnyen gyi tshogs la'o //
translated: Then, the assembly of monks, novices, and lay practitioners.

original: gang las btung ba brtsam pa tha mar de nyid la bsnyod par bya'o //
analyzed: gang las btung ba brtsam pa tha mar de nyid la bsnyod par bya'o //
translated: At the end, one should offer the drink to the one from whom it was begun.

original: de nas re re'i mdun du tshod ma sna tshogs pa dang / sha sna tshogs pa dang ro drug dang ldan pa'i rgyal po'i s'a lu la sogs pas bkang ba'i snod rnams 'bul bas tshim par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas re re'i mdun du tshod ma sna tshogs pa dang / sha sna tshogs pa dang ro drug dang ldan pa'i rgyal po'i s'a lu la sogs pas bkang ba'i snod rnams 'bul bas tshim par bya'o //
translated: Then, in front of each one, one should offer various vegetables, various meats, and the king's rice and so forth endowed with the six flavors, filling the vessels.

original: phyed zos pas bza' bca' thams cad snod gcig tu bsdus te thams cad kyis gcig tu bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyed zos pas bza' bca' thams cad snod gcig tu bsdus te thams cad kyis gcig tu bza' bar bya'o //
translated: Having eaten half, one should gather all the food and drink into one vessel and all should eat together.

original: de nas btung ba'i snod rnams gcig tu bsres te btung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas btung ba'i snod rnams gcig tu bsres te btung bar bya'o //
translated: Then, having mixed the vessels of drink into one, one should drink.

original: las kyi rdo rjes kyang cang te'u la yi ge gsum gyis mchod par bya ste /
analyzed: las kyi rdo rjes kyang cang te'u la yi ge gsum gyis mchod par bya ste /
translated: The karma vajra should also make offerings to the hand drum with the three syllables.

original: lag pa g-yas pas blangs la h'um phat ces bya ba'i sgra sgrogs par bya'o //
analyzed: lag pa g-yas pas blangs la h'um phat ces bya ba'i sgra sgrogs par bya'o //
translated: Having taken it with the right hand, one should make the sound of hum phat.

original: rdo rje rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis rdo rje'i gar sna tshogs bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis rdo rje'i gar sna tshogs bya'o //
translated: The vajra yoginis should perform various vajra dances.

original: tshogs kyi bdag pos gar bya ba dang / gzhan ma rnams kyis glu ngang rol mo bya'o zhes la la 'dod do //
analyzed: tshogs kyi bdag pos gar bya ba dang / gzhan ma rnams kyis glu ngang rol mo bya'o zhes la la 'dod do //
translated: Some maintain that the lords of the ganacakra dance, and the others sing and play musical instruments.

original: thams cad kyis kyang gar bya'o zhes la la 'dod do //
analyzed: thams cad kyis kyang gar bya'o zhes la la 'dod do //
translated: Others maintain that all of them dance.

original: dam par dga' ba skyes pa na gar bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: dam par dga' ba skyes pa na gar bya ba yin gyi /
translated: When supreme joy arises, one should dance.

original: gzhan du na sems rtse gcig par gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na sems rtse gcig par gnas par bya'o //
translated: Otherwise, one should remain in a state of one-pointed mind.

original: tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i phyin gyis rlob pa'i rtags ni ngang pa dang bung ba dang khyu mchog dang 'ug pa la zhon pa'i mkha' 'gro ma rnams 'ong bar gyur pa na de rnams kyi lus kyi dri sgog skya dang ga bur dang padma dang / sha'i dri bro ba dang /
analyzed: tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i phyin gyis rlob pa'i rtags ni ngang pa dang bung ba dang khyu mchog dang 'ug pa la zhon pa'i mkha' 'gro ma rnams 'ong bar gyur pa na de rnams kyi lus kyi dri sgog skya dang ga bur dang padma dang / sha'i dri bro ba dang /
translated: The signs of the consecration of the ganacakra are that the dakinis riding on geese, bees, bulls, and owls come. At that time, one should smell the odor of their bodies, which smells like garlic, camphor, lotus, and meat.

original: ngang pa la sogs pa'i sgra thos pas so //
analyzed: ngang pa la sogs pa'i sgra thos pas so //
translated: One should hear the sounds of the geese and so forth.

original: de'i tshe de rnams la lhag ma'i gtor ma rgyas par sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe de rnams la lhag ma'i gtor ma rgyas par sbyin par bya'o //
translated: At that time, one should give them the extensive remainder torma.

original: tshogs kyi nang du rtsod pa'am rgod pa'am rtog pa gang gis byed pa de de ma thag tu phyi rol du dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshogs kyi nang du rtsod pa'am rgod pa'am rtog pa gang gis byed pa de de ma thag tu phyi rol du dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: Whoever causes a dispute, or excitement, or thought in the midst of the assembly, he should be immediately expelled.

original: bzod par gsol ba byed na mchod pa'i las byed du bzhugs so //
analyzed: bzod par gsol ba byed na mchod pa'i las byed du bzhugs so //
translated: If he asks for forgiveness, he should be allowed to stay and do the work of worship.

original: de nas lag pa la sogs pa bkrus la me tog gi gcal bkram par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas lag pa la sogs pa bkrus la me tog gi gcal bkram par bya ste /
translated: Then, having washed the hands, etc., one should strew the flower-carpet.

original: so rtsi phul la yon rnam pa bzhi pos mnyes par bya ste /
analyzed: so rtsi phul la yon rnam pa bzhi pos mnyes par bya ste /
translated: Having offered tooth-sticks, one should please them with the four kinds of gifts.

original: gshegs su gsol bas tshigs su bcad pas tshogs kyi 'khor lo gshegs @39a * //üîΩsu gsol lo //
analyzed: gshegs su gsol bas tshigs su bcad pas tshogs kyi 'khor lo gshegs @39a * // su gsol lo //
translated: Having requested them to depart, one should request the wheel of the ga·πáa to depart with a verse.

analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang / sngags kyi sku dang / ye shes kyi sku dang / bskyed pa dang / rdzogs pa dang / rtog pa'i rnal 'byor dang / yongs su rdzogs pa dang / stong pa nyid dang snying rje dang / thabs dang shes rab la sogs pa'i gnyis par 'dzin pa'i bag chags thams cad med pas bcu gnyis pa kun tu 'od ces bya ba la gnas pa'o //
translated: Since all habitual tendencies of dualistic grasping, such as entity and non-entity, mantra body and wisdom body, creation and completion, conceptual yoga and perfect yoga, emptiness and compassion, method and wisdom, and so on, do not exist, it is called the twelfth stage, All-Illumination.

original: de bas na de las ldang ba'i dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes la gnas pa sa bcu gsum pa thob pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i spyod pa zung du 'jug pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na de las ldang ba'i dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes la gnas pa sa bcu gsum pa thob pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i spyod pa zung du 'jug pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the pure mundane gnosis that arises from that is the attainment of the thirteenth stage, the essence of the conduct of perfection, which is the union.

original: dper na bram ze dang gdol pa dang / smad 'tshod ma dang / bu mo dang chung ma dang / ga bur dang / bshang ba dang / drag po dang / rdo rje 'chang ba dang / mtho ris dang ngan song dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang /
analyzed: dper na bram ze dang gdol pa dang / smad 'tshod ma dang / bu mo dang chung ma dang / ga bur dang / bshang ba dang / drag po dang / rdo rje 'chang ba dang / mtho ris dang ngan song dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang /
translated: For example, like a Brahmin and an outcaste, a prostitute, a daughter, a wife, camphor, excrement, Shiva, Vajradhara, heaven and the lower realms, happiness and suffering,

original: grags pa dang grags pa ma yin pa dang / rnyed pa dang rnyed pa ma yin pa dang / bstod pa dang smad pa la sogs pa dang bral ba /
analyzed: grags pa dang grags pa ma yin pa dang / rnyed pa dang rnyed pa ma yin pa dang / bstod pa dang smad pa la sogs pa dang bral ba /
translated: fame and lack of fame, gain and lack of gain, praise and blame, and so on.

original: rjes su dran pa dang ma 'dres pa'i chos dang ldan pa /
analyzed: rjes su dran pa dang ma 'dres pa'i chos dang ldan pa /
translated: He is endowed with the Dharma that is not mixed with recollection.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku 'dzin pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku 'dzin pa /
translated: He is the embodiment of the Buddha's body.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig nas gcig tu sems can gyi don mdzad pa la brtson pa dpal bde ba chen po'i rnam grangs can rdo rje sems dpa' nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig nas gcig tu sems can gyi don mdzad pa la brtson pa dpal bde ba chen po'i rnam grangs can rdo rje sems dpa' nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: He is the one who is diligent in benefiting sentient beings from one buddha realm to another, the one who is synonymous with glorious great bliss, Vajrasattva himself.

original: de lta na gal te 'bras bu de yin na rgyu nyid du ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na gal te 'bras bu de yin na rgyu nyid du ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: If that is the case, if it is the result, how could it be the cause?

original: gang gi phyir rim pa bzhi po ni thabs te rgyu'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rim pa bzhi po ni thabs te rgyu'o //
translated: Because the four stages are the method, the cause.

original: lnga pa ni mi slob pa'i ngo bo nyid 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: lnga pa ni mi slob pa'i ngo bo nyid 'bras bu'o //
translated: The fifth is the nature of the non-learner, the result.

original: de ci'i phyir gcig la rgyu nyid dang 'bras bu nyid 'thad ce na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir gcig la rgyu nyid dang 'bras bu nyid 'thad ce na /
translated: Why is it tenable that one is both cause and result?

original: smras pa ro gcig pa'i zung du 'jug pa la blos brtags pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tha snyad yin gyi dam pa'i don du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa ro gcig pa'i zung du 'jug pa la blos brtags pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tha snyad yin gyi dam pa'i don du ni ma yin no //
translated: It is said that the convention of cause and result is imputed by the mind to the union of one taste, but not in an ultimate sense.

original: de ltar thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob pa'i rnal 'byor pa la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bye brag tu gnas pa'i dngos po thams cad ngo bo gcig kho na yin gyi bye brag tu de la de rnams snang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob pa'i rnal 'byor pa la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bye brag tu gnas pa'i dngos po thams cad ngo bo gcig kho na yin gyi bye brag tu de la de rnams snang ba ma yin no //
translated: Thus, for the yogi who has attained the gnosis of omniscience, all things that abide as the distinctions of cause and result are of one nature alone. They do not appear to him as distinct.

original: bdag cag lta bu gzhal bar byed pa rnams kyis de ltar 'dod pa la skyon med do //
analyzed: bdag cag lta bu gzhal bar byed pa rnams kyis de ltar 'dod pa la skyon med do //
translated: For us evaluators, there is no fault in asserting that.

original: yang na srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam par rtog pa phan tshun bye brag tu rab tu 'jug pa de rnams kho na ro gcig par shes pas ting nge 'dzin mngon du 'gyur zhes rgyu dang @43a * //
analyzed: yang na srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam par rtog pa phan tshun bye brag tu rab tu 'jug pa de rnams kho na ro gcig par shes pas ting nge 'dzin mngon du 'gyur zhes rgyu dang @43a * //
translated: Or else, the concentration manifests through the knowledge that the various conceptual thoughts of cyclic existence and nirvana are of one taste.

original: 'bras bu'i bye brag 'di ni brtags pa yin pas gnod pa gang yang med do //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i bye brag 'di ni brtags pa yin pas gnod pa gang yang med do //
translated: Since this distinction between cause and effect is a mere conceptual imputation, it is not at all problematic.

original: de lta na gal te ting nge 'dzin 'di yin na /
analyzed: de lta na gal te ting nge 'dzin 'di yin na /
translated: If this is the case, then if this is concentration,

original: ji ltar ldang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar ldang bar 'gyur te /

original: ldang ba med na de'i tshe sems can gyi don med ces phan tshun 'gal ba thob par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ldang ba med na de'i tshe sems can gyi don med ces phan tshun 'gal ba thob par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If there is no arising, then at that time there is no benefit for sentient beings.

original: smras pa ldang ba zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin nyams par byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: smras pa ldang ba zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin nyams par byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: We reply: Arising does not mean that one falls away from concentration.

original: 'on kyang ting nge 'dzin la zhugs pa nyid kyis 'gro ba'i don mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang ting nge 'dzin la zhugs pa nyid kyis 'gro ba'i don mdzad pa'o //

original: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi spyod lam rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi spyod lam rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Because the four types of conduct of the transcendent conquerors are as follows.

original: spyod lam gyi bzhugs pa dang / bstan pa'i bzhugs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi bzhugs pa dang / so sor yang dag pa'i 'jug pa'i bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: spyod lam gyi bzhugs pa dang / bstan pa'i bzhugs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi bzhugs pa dang / so sor yang dag pa'i 'jug pa'i bzhugs pa'o //
translated: the abiding of deportment, the abiding of teaching, the abiding of samadhi, and the abiding of correct engagement.

original: de la sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku'i phrin las rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de ni spyod lam gyi bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku'i phrin las rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de ni spyod lam gyi bzhugs pa'o //
translated: The abiding of deportment is the constant composure of the Buddha's physical activity.

original: gang gsung gi phrin las rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de ni bstan pa'i bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gsung gi phrin las rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de ni bstan pa'i bzhugs pa'o //
translated: The abiding of teaching is the constant composure of his verbal activity.

original: gang thugs kyi phrin las rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de ni ting nge 'dzin gyi bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: gang thugs kyi phrin las rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de ni ting nge 'dzin gyi bzhugs pa'o //
translated: The abiding of samadhi is the constant composure of his mental activity.

original: gang sangs rgyas rnams kyis mthong ba'i chos kyi bde ba'i bzhugs pa dang / lha la sogs pa'i gnas su nye bar gshegs pa la thugs kyi phrin las rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de ni so sor yang dag par 'jug pa'i bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: gang sangs rgyas rnams kyis mthong ba'i chos kyi bde ba'i bzhugs pa dang / lha la sogs pa'i gnas su nye bar gshegs pa la thugs kyi phrin las rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de ni so sor yang dag par 'jug pa'i bzhugs pa'o //
translated: The abiding of correct engagement is the constant composure of the mental activity of the Buddha's activity of seeing the Dharma and of going to the abodes of the gods and so forth.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i spyod pa ni bzhugs pa ste gang gi phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pas so //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i spyod pa ni bzhugs pa ste gang gi phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pas so //
translated: The conduct of equipoise is abiding, because the BhagavƒÅn Buddha is always in equipoise.

original: de ltar zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin las ldang yang rung mi ldang yang rung khyad par gang yang med de zhes ting nge 'dzin kho na yin te /
analyzed: de ltar zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin las ldang yang rung mi ldang yang rung khyad par gang yang med de zhes ting nge 'dzin kho na yin te /

analyzed: gal te phyogs gnyis ka la mtshungs pa yin na de ci'i phyir rnam par mi rtog par gyur nas kyang sems can gyi don byed ce na /
translated: If it is the same in both cases, why does he not benefit sentient beings after becoming nonconceptual?

original: smras pa sngon gyi smon lam dang thugs rje chen po'i shugs kyis sems can gyi don mdzad pa yin gyi rnam par rtog pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa sngon gyi smon lam dang thugs rje chen po'i shugs kyis sems can gyi don mdzad pa yin gyi rnam par rtog pas ni ma yin no //
translated: It is said that he benefits sentient beings by the power of his previous aspirations and great compassion, but not by conceptual thought.

analyzed: sems can rnams kyi yang de phrad pa tsam gyis re ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang bum pa bzang po bzhin no //

analyzed: de ni phrad pa tsam gyis ni //

analyzed: skyes bu yid bzhin nor bu ltar//
translated: like the wish-fulfilling jewel,

original: @43b rtsig pa la sogs rnams las kyang //
analyzed: @43b rtsig pa la sogs rnams las kyang //
translated: from walls and so forth

analyzed: ji 'dod bstan pa rnams ni 'byung // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: appearances arise as desired.

original: de bas na sangs rgyas kyi sa la nyon mongs pa'i dra ba zad nas kyang sngon gyi smon lam gyi 'phen pa'i dbang gis skur byung ba dang sems can gyi don yang 'byung ste /

analyzed: rdza mkhan gyi 'khor lo bzhin no //

analyzed: skyon med pa yang thugs rjes sgyu ma'i skyes bu las la 'jug / blo bzang sngon gyi smon lam dbang gis 'khor lo 'khor bzhin gnas// zhes 'byung ngo //

analyzed: kam pa la'i zhal snga nas kyis kyang gsungs te /

analyzed: bde blag tu go bas phan tshun slob dpon dang slob ma dag gi 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po'i 'brel pa dang bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / bsnyen bkur bya ba dang / thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pas rtogs pas zab cing rgya che ba bla na med pas sems can ma lus pa la rjes su gzung bar byed pa dpal rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob pa ni bya ba'i 'bras bu'i 'bras bu'o//
translated: The result of the result of action is the attainment of the state of glorious great Vajradhara, who is the protector of all sentient beings through the unsurpassed profound and extensive path, by means of the mutual relationship of the teacher and the disciple, the expounder and the listener, the one who is to be honored and the one who honors, and by means of the realization through listening, reflection and meditation.

original: @44a * // de yod pas nyan pa po 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @44a * // de yod pas nyan pa po 'jug par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan yang brjod pa la sogs pa rnam pa lnga bo nyan pa po 'jug par bya ba'i phyir smra bar bya ste /

analyzed: rjod pa dang brjod par bya ba dang / 'brel pa dang / dgos pa dang / dgos pa'i dgos pa'o //

analyzed: dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rnal 'byor gyi rgyud chen po thos pa chung ba'i slob dpon gyis bshad pa'i mun pas khebs pa'i rdo rje'i tshig rnams sgron ma ltar gsal bar byed cing ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par gsal bar byed pas na sgron ma gsal ba'o
translated: The word ‚Äúillumination‚Äù is used because it illuminates the vajra words that are obscured by the darkness of the explanations of teachers who have heard little of the great yoga tantra of glorious Guhyasamaja, and because it illuminates them just as they are.

analyzed: // mtha' drug ces bya ba ni de nyid kyi don gyi sgo nas ming yin te /

analyzed: brjod par bya ba drug du bstan pa'i phyir rjod par byed pa'o //

analyzed: brjod par bya ba ni sngon du bshad pa'i rim pa gnyis te /

analyzed: gnyis pa ni rnam pa lnga ste ngag rnam par dben pa nas brtsams te mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: The second has five parts: beginning with the isolation of speech up to nonabiding nirvana.

original: 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni sgra dang don dag gis thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i mtshan nyid dam //
analyzed: 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni sgra dang don dag gis thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i mtshan nyid dam //

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshul lam /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshul lam /

analyzed: rjod pa dang brjod par bya ba'i mtshan nyid nges par shes par bya'o //

analyzed: gal te sgra dang don dag gis 'brel pa gtso bo yod pa ma yin yang blos byas pa kho na'o //
translated: If the relation of word and meaning does not exist essentially, but is only fabricated by the mind,

analyzed: gang gi phyir sgra dang don dag la 'brel pa med de rang gi mtshan nyid ston mi nus pa'i phyir ro //

translated: For example, a tree and a ≈õi·πÉ≈õapƒÅ tree, or being produced and being impermanent, are inseparable. However, a tree and a ≈õi·πÉ≈õapƒÅ tree, or being produced and being impermanent, are not the same. In the same way, a word and its meaning are not inseparable.

original: dper na sgra rjod par gyur pa na skyes bu'i kha yongs su khengs par 'gyur ba'i don gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na sgra rjod par gyur pa na skyes bu'i kha yongs su khengs par 'gyur ba'i don gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: For example, when a word is uttered, the mouth of a person does not become filled with the meaning of that word.

original: sgra ni skad cig ma yin pa'i @44b phyir brjod ma thag tu rnam par 'jig go //
analyzed: sgra ni skad cig ma yin pa'i @44b phyir brjod ma thag tu rnam par 'jig go //

analyzed: don ni bum pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid phyi rol du yod pa de yang skad cig ma can ma yin zhes de dag tha dad pa'o //

analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dag gis phan tshun spangs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'gal bas de'i bdag nyid med do //
translated: Since difference and non-difference are mutually exclusive, they do not have the same nature.

original: gal te skyon de bsal bar bya ba'i phyir tha dad pa'i don la yang don sgrar mtshan brda'i sgo nas rjod par byed ce na /
analyzed: gal te skyon de bsal bar bya ba'i phyir tha dad pa'i don la yang don sgrar mtshan brda'i sgo nas rjod par byed ce na /

original: de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te /
translated: that also is not correct.

original: gang gi phyir dngos po'i chos nyid du gnas pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid mi rtog pa'i ye shes pa'i spyod yul ni brdas bstan par mi nus te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po'i chos nyid du gnas pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid mi rtog pa'i ye shes pa'i spyod yul ni brdas bstan par mi nus te /

analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dang / ming dang rigs la sogs pa'i dbye bas kyang brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: re zhig brjod bya ni skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir mi gnas te /

original: rjod par byed pa de yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: rjod par byed pa de yang de bzhin te /

original: dngos po thams cad skad cig mas khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad skad cig mas khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all things are pervaded by momentariness.

original: brda ni tha snyad la dgos pa ste //üîΩgang la brten pa'i tha snyad de //
analyzed: brda ni tha snyad la dgos pa ste // gang la brten pa'i tha snyad de //
translated: A convention is for the purpose of usage.

original: gal te gnas par mi 'gyur na //
analyzed: gal te gnas par mi 'gyur na //

analyzed: de'i tshe gang gi brda yin te //

analyzed: ji skad du tshad ma rnam 'grel las // sgra rnams kyis ni brda can ston //
translated: As it is said in the PramaÃÑnÔ¨Å avaÃÑrtika:üîΩWords express the conventional.

original: de ni tha snyad phyir bshad pa //
analyzed: de ni tha snyad phyir bshad pa //
translated: It is explained to be for the sake of usage.

original: de tshe rang gi mtshan nyid med //
analyzed: de tshe rang gi mtshan nyid med //

original: des na de la brda med do //
analyzed: des na de la brda med do //

analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo// de bas na de'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel pa med pa kho na'o //

analyzed: de las byung ba'i 'brel pa yang med de /

analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: don gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is in conformity with the object and because it is in conformity with the presence and absence of the object.

original: du ba dang me bzhin no //
analyzed: du ba dang me bzhin no //
translated: Like smoke and fire.üîΩWhen fire exists, smoke exists; when fire does not exist, smoke does not exist.

translated: And when the causes of smoke, such as fuel, etc., exist without deficiency, smoke exists. Thus, the existence and nonexistence of the effect is due to the existence and nonexistence of the cause.

original: de ni rgyu'i rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rgyu'i rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is in conformity with the cause.

analyzed: de bas na yod pa dang med pa dag gis byas pa'i bdag nyid yod pa dang med pa can gyi du bas me rtogs par byed do //

original: rtogs pa dang rtogs par bya ba'i dngos po'am /
analyzed: rtogs pa dang rtogs par bya ba'i dngos po'am /
translated: The existence of the object of knowledge and the knower,

analyzed: bsgrub bya dang sgrub par byed pa dngos po dag gi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa kho na rgyu yin no //

original: de lta bu'i rigs pa sgra dang don dag la med de /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rigs pa sgra dang don dag la med de /
translated: Such reasoning does not exist in regard to word and object.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i don yod pas kyang @45a * //
translated: And also, because the object, such as a pot, exists,

analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba dang rgya mtsho la sogs pa'i sgra bzhin no //

analyzed: de'i phyir don gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med pas sgra dang don dag gis de las byung ba'i 'brel pa med do //

original: de la smras pa /üîΩrang gi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa med de spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis byas pa'i 'brel pa yod pa nyid de dper na rtog bcas kyi shes pa la spyi'i tshul du don gyi rnam pa gang snang ba de nyid kyis pha rol po la rtogs par bya ba'i phyir
analyzed: de la smras pa / rang gi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa med de spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis byas pa'i 'brel pa yod pa nyid de dper na rtog bcas kyi shes pa la spyi'i tshul du don gyi rnam pa gang snang ba de nyid kyis pha rol po la rtogs par bya ba'i phyir
translated: To this we reply:

original: 'bras bur gyur pa'i sgra skyed par byed do //
analyzed: 'bras bur gyur pa'i sgra skyed par byed do //
translated: There is no relation of intrinsic identity, but there is a relation that is created by intrinsic identity. For example, in a conceptual consciousness, the form of an object that appears in the form of a universal is the cause of the utterance of a sound that is the result, in order to make that known to others.

original: spyi'i sgra'i rnam pa des kyang nyan pa po'i rgyud la rtog pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: spyi'i sgra'i rnam pa des kyang nyan pa po'i rgyud la rtog pa skyed par byed do //
translated: The form of the general sound also produces a concept in the mind of the hearer.

analyzed: de'i phyir sgra'i yul gang yin pa de nyid rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi yul lo //

analyzed: de bas sgra dang don rnams kyi btags pa pa'i 'brel pa yod pa kho na'o //
translated: Thus, the relation of the word to the object is only a conventional one.

original: de nyid la brten te nye bar brtags pas rang gi mtshan nyid la yang sgra 'jug gi 'jug pa gtso bos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid la brten te nye bar brtags pas rang gi mtshan nyid la yang sgra 'jug gi 'jug pa gtso bos ni ma yin no //
translated: The word is applied to the particular on the basis of that relation, but the word is not applied to the particular by the primary relation.

analyzed: 'brel pa de yang rnam pa drug tu 'gyur te /

analyzed: de la dang po 'gro ba 'di dag mun par gyur pa stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du yod de /

translated: Then, because of the long duration of the gods who dwell in the form realm of the fourth concentration, in the sphere of infinite space, in the sphere of infinite consciousness, in the sphere of nothingness, and in the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception,

analyzed: de'i de ma thag tu de rnams gzugs can du gyur to//

original: de nas chags pa dang mngon par 'brel pa'i dbang gis rang gi lus las bcud kyi rang bzhin char gyi rgyun 'bab par 'gyur ro //

translated: That rain, which is yellow in color, becomes the earth element in the form of mud.

analyzed: yang dus kyi dbang gis de dum bu bzhir gas nas gling bzhi dang dkyil du ri @45b rab kyi rgyal po yang dag par byung bar gyur to //

original: de nas de dag kyang de nyid du babs so //
analyzed: de nas de dag kyang de nyid du babs so //

original: bag chags ldang ba'i shugs kyis bud med dang skyes pa'i rtags su gyur pas phan tshun 'brel pa'i dbang gis skye dgu dang rigs bzhi'i tha snyad kyang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bag chags ldang ba'i shugs kyis bud med dang skyes pa'i rtags su gyur pas phan tshun 'brel pa'i dbang gis skye dgu dang rigs bzhi'i tha snyad kyang 'byung ngo //
translated: By the force of the arising of the latent tendencies, the signs of male and female appeared, and by the power of their mutual attraction, the terms ‚Äúman‚Äù and ‚Äúwoman‚Äù and the four castes arose.
